name: Brewster's Mountain Lodge

reviews.text: We stayed at Brewsters for a night mid April. We decided on this hotel for a couple of reasons-it was a good price for 3 adults and it was right in the middle of Banff. We were meeting our son there and he arrived early so the reception clerk let him go up to the room and settle in before we arrived. Reception was most helpful with checking in and parking. We had rented a large car which did not fit in the Brewsters car park so we needed somewhere to park it. The clerk was able to tell us a safe and secure place. Our room was quite large with 2 queen beds. The bathroom was basic and in need of a fix up. There was no fan and so it did tend to fog up after a shower. The room was very clean, sheets were crisp and pillows comfy. The lodge is a bit of a maze and can be difficult to find your way around once upstairs. Our room faced an interior courtyard and so we did not get any noise which seemed to be a problem for some of the other reviewers. Breakfast was very good with fresh fruit salad, yoghurt s, cereals, toast and pastries as well as teas and coffee. I would definitely stay here again as it is right in the centre of town so you have very little walking to get to shops and restaurants.
reviews.title: Right in the middle of Banff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel in Apr 2013. Located right in the heart of downtown Banff. Decor is rustic log cabin, pretty cool. Rooms are average, but staff were friendly and continental breakfast made it worthwhile.
reviews.title: Great location, decent price

reviews.text: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Excellent location in town, few minutes away from bus pick up point. Staff courtenous, helpful and friendly, Our room was cleaned to a high standard and was extremely comfortable. Continental breakfast was just what we needed. Saved us having to go out of the Hotel to eat. Enjoyed the whirlpool jacuzzi but Sauna did not appear to be hot enough to enjoy. We would recommend this hotel and if we returned to Banff would probably stay at Brewsters again.
reviews.title: Good value, excellent location

reviews.text: The room was incredible with extremely comfortable beds and a wonderful jetted tub. The hotel is located perfectly so that we just parked in the garage and walked everywhere in town. We enjoyed the nearby bars and restaurants. When we were finally ready to leave we had no trouble checking out and were on our way way when we discovered a flat tire. A staff member helped us remove a rusted on wheel and helped to repair the tire. When we tried to give him some money for his help he refused to take it. we found out that he was actually a retired friend of the owners who helps out occasionally. It was great to find such a friendly atmosphere and we are sure to come back.
reviews.title: Above and Beyond

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The quality of this hotel always far exceeds my expectations based on the cost. This was my second stay at Brewster's and I continue to be exceptionally pleased with the hotel. The staff are incredibly helpful, friendly and accomodating to all your needs. They even went so far as to bring all of our bags up to our rooms for us because the elevator was out of service when we checked in (we were only on the second floor and would have been perfectly capable of doing it ourselves). The location could not be better. The rooms are clean, spacious and have views of two of the main streets on a background of mountains. I couldn't have asked for more. The fact that it's near several bars wan't even a problem because the outside noise did not travel into the rooms enough to disturb. The breakfast, which is included in the cost of the room, had a good asortment of selection to chose from.
reviews.title: Another great stay

reviews.text: Check in was efficient. Asked for a quieter room and got one. Room and bed was comfortable. The morning breakfast was decent. Fresh fruit salad. It is included in the price of the hotel. Convenient location and underground indoor parking was nice, but there was a minimal charge. The parking spots were tight though. The WIFI was still spotty reception (free though). Our second trip to this hotel and would recommend.
reviews.title: Family Day weekend trip

reviews.text: We have skiing in Banff for over 15 years and this was the first time we had stayed at Brewsters and have we been missing out. The rooms are clean and comfortable. Even though it is right downtown we didn't hear much noise of the two-legged variety of wildlife that some others have posted on this site. Its not a five star hotel but it does offer good value for your dollar and its nice to park the car and just walk to restaurants and shops. Try doing that in Canmore or up on Tunnel Mountain.
reviews.title: Great place right in the middle of Banff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Super friendly front desk staff; told us about town's winter activities. Great price! Comfy bed; clean room; great decor; couldn't ask for better. Centrally located just off main street. We parked our car safely at the hotel; underground parking space and walked downtown to have a lovely time with no parking worries. Breakfast was included in our stay; appreciated this tasty add on. Went skiing at Mt Norquay using town shuttle bus and came back to a well-deserved good night's sleep. Would recommend this hotel to all.
reviews.title: Great hotel to stay at

reviews.text: As a group of 6 Adults who have been skiing together for over 30 years we looked forward to our first skiing trip to Canada. We booked this Hotel for its central location, its smaller size (77 rooms) and its 'western look'. The rooms were more than adequate, well equipped with coffee machine,kettle, iron and board and hairdryer. Two queen size beds which were comfortable and gave a good nights sleep.
reviews.title: Enoyable time had by all

reviews.text: Contental breakfast included, a little limited, but still with some choice, and was more than adequate for setting you up for the morning.
reviews.title: wonderful stay & will be coming back

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here in April and it is what I expected. The staff were great, the room was what I requested which was on the 3rd floor, which I highly recommend, on the corner of the building. We could hear some noise in our room, but it was minimal. The location is great as we just parked the car in the underground parking lot, which is quite small, and walked everywhere. Continental breakfast is just that with bagels, bread for toasting, juice, tea, coffee, yogourt, fruit, and a few cereals. Our room was the standard 2 queens, pretty nice size beds, though not too firm. Overall, nice stay and great value for what we paid with a Travelzoo deal that included 2 free beers at Banff Brewing Company, great beer, staff, and atmosphere as well as coupons at Melissa's.
reviews.title: What I expected

reviews.text: Friends are ours were staying at the Fairmont and as much as we wanted to travel with them we just weren't in a position to. One of my co-workers told me they enjoyed their stay at Brewster's so book it we did. The location is fantastic, right in town and if you do want to walk to the Fairmont as we did you can do it in 15 minutes. The room was bright and clean, we were in 219 which overlooks a bar but the outside noise didn't affect our ability to get a good nights sleep at all. The bed was super comfortable. There's free wi-fi but safe that for checking emergency email and not for streaming anything as it's didn't appear to be super speedy. The breakfast room "Birdsnest" was adequate, the coffee was a pleasant surprise in that it was really good. We were traveling with our one year old son so were happy to see a high chair there...makes breakfast so much easier. They've got onsite underground parking as well. It's best to park on the street while you check in so you can get your room card which also serves as access to the parkade. Make sure you have your most confident driver at the wheel when it comes time to park. The entrance is a bit narrow between two pillars and then it's a hard left to the key box to open the door, There was always a spot for us but some of them were tight and required some navigation. It's doable but you'll want to take your time. The hotel staff was great at answering our questions and letting us leave the car behind a bit after checkout so we could get lattes for our drive. We'd stay here again in a heartbeat.
reviews.title: Brewster's was exactly what we needed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had to make a last minute change to our travel plans and chose Brewster's Mountain Lodge with little time for research. We were very pleased with our choice and immediately extended our stay from one to two nights. The desk staff were very courteous and helpful.
reviews.title: A great lodge in a beautiful location

reviews.text: They provide an excellent continental breakfast with a choice of fruit, yoghurt, cereal, bagels, toast, and pastries. There are the usual beverages including coffee, tea, and juices. The pastries were delicious and I made quite a pig of myself the first morning.
reviews.title: Thoroughly enjoyable hotel with history!
Our second stay here
reviews.text: We booked a helicopter tour from a Canmore company which shuttled us to and from their home base. This was the first trip in a helicopter for my companion and she was thrilled with the 25+ minute flight.

I've stayed at the hotel on several occasions and I WAS a huge fan and recommended the hotel to friends and colleagues. Until my recent stay.... I was unbelievably dissappointed. I understand it was a weekend but the price was much higher than normal and I was put in a room that was incredibly LOUD. I had street noise from 11pm till 4am. The noise from the room above me was undesirable. I was unable to sleep at all. I called the front desk throughout the night and the next day seeking a different room but the staff were unfortunately unhelpful.
reviews.title: Loud, Disappointed and Overpriced

reviews.text: The front desk staff told me that street noise is common in that room?? it wouldve been great to have been told that when i checked in and before i paid. After little to no sleep, I went to have a shower and found a pile of hair on the floor. And a used cotton bud that had cleaned someone's ear left on the floor of the bedroom.
reviews.title: Comfortable Hotel

reviews.text: I intended on staying an extra night, instead I checked out and stayed at a different hotel for a smaller price tag and a much better quality of sleep.
reviews.title: This hotel is positioned in an ideal location and in central Banff with friendly knowledgable staff. Ski bus is 3 minutes wal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My son and I stayed at the Brewsters Mountain Lodge in March 2013 and I have to say it was an exceedingly comfortable Hotel with very friendly staff.
reviews.title: Pretty good

reviews.text: Our room was a decent size with ok bathroom and the beds were exceedingly comfortable and with the fantastic front staff made our stay very relaxing and ready for the boarding each day.
reviews.title: Good skiing hotel

description: Brewster’s Mountain lodge is located in the heart of Downtown Banff, steps from shopping, dining, and nightlife. This 77-room hotel features complimentary continental breakfast and wireless internet included in all of our rates. We offer a sauna, hot tub, and small exercise area for our guests to enjoy after an exciting day of exploring! Handcrafted log furnishings and western décor define the interior of our lodge, as well as a wood-burning fireplace in the lobby.
